alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 10:47AM CDT until April 20 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and colder temperatures in the forecast. This is the last statement to be issued for the Snake River below Warren as it has fallen below flood stage. Ice jamming continues to impact Crookston. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River AT Alvarado. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 106.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Storm sewer flood gates are closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 101.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall to 101.6 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 102.1 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 106.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
